name: EGRF v3.0 Corpus
description: Corpus of Existential Graph examples for testing EGRF v3.0

examples.title: Peirce's Man-Mortal Implication
examples.description: Peirce's classic example of implication: 'If a man, then mortal'

examples.title: Canonical Implication
examples.description: Standard form of implication using double-cut

examples.title: Roberts' Disjunction Example
examples.description: Roberts' example of disjunction: 'P or Q'

examples.title: Dau's Ligature Example
examples.description: Dau's example of ligatures crossing cut boundaries

examples.title: Stanford Nested Quantifiers
examples.description: Nested quantifier scopes: Everyone loves someone

examples.title: Peirce Complex Scope
examples.description: Three-way mixed quantifiers with complex nesting

examples.title: Ternary Relation Challenge
examples.description: Three-way relation with complex ligature routing

examples.title: Peirce's Modus Ponens
examples.description: Peirce's demonstration of modus ponens inference rule

examples.title: Sowa's Cat on Mat Example
examples.description: Foundational EGIF example demonstrating basic syntax

examples.title: Peirce's Metalevel Gamma Graph
examples.description: Metalevel statements using Gamma graph extensions
examples.source: Peirce (1898) Reasoning and Logic of Things

examples.title: Dau's Theorem Proving Example
examples.description: Complex nested quantifier structure for theorem proving

examples.title: Endoporeutic Game Starting Position
examples.description: Classic EPG starting position with multiple transformation paths

examples.title: Roberts' Domain Modeling Example
examples.description: Complex domain model with inheritance and multiple relations

examples.title: Modal Logic with Necessity and Possibility
examples.description: Modal operators using Peirce's Gamma graph extensions
